title: What is the Miami tennis schedule?
description: Novak Djokovic will aim for another piece of history Sunday at the Miami Open presented by Itau, where the Serbian is seeking his 100th tour-level title and a record-breaking seventh Miami trophy. The Serbian faces Jakub Mensik in the championship match at 3 p.m. local time. UPDATE: The Miami singles final has been delayed by rain. Check this article for updates. At age 37 and 10 months, Djokovic is the oldest finalist in ATP Masters 1000 series history (since 1990). He seeks to surpass Andre Agassi (6) for most Miami titles.  View the full Sunday order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - SUNDAY, 30 MARCH 2025 Stadium - start 12:30 p.m. WTA Doubles Final Not Before 3 p.m. ATP - Singles Final - Jakub Mensik (CZE) vs [4] Novak Djokovic (SRB) [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: The men's singles final at the Miami Open presented by Itau will take place Sunday, not before 3 p.m. local time, between Novak Djokovic and Jakub Mensik.
text: Miami Men's singles final Sunday March 30, 2025 Michael Reaves/Getty Images The 2025 Miami Open presented by Itau will be held from 19-30 March at the Hard Rock Stadium. By ATP Staff Novak Djokovic will aim for another piece of history Sunday at the Miami Open presented by Itau, where the Serbian is seeking his 100th tour-level title and a record-breaking seventh Miami trophy. The Serbian faces Jakub Mensik in the championship match at 3 p.m. local time. UPDATE: The Miami singles final has been delayed by rain. Check this article for updates. At age 37 and 10 months, Djokovic is the oldest finalist in ATP Masters 1000 series history (since 1990). He seeks to surpass Andre Agassi (6) for most Miami titles.  View the full Sunday order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - SUNDAY, 30 MARCH 2025 Stadium - start 12:30 p.m. WTA Doubles Final Not Before 3 p.m. ATP - Singles Final - Jakub Mensik (CZE) vs [4] Novak Djokovic (SRB)
html:
Miami

Men's singles final Sunday

March 30, 2025

Michael Reaves/Getty Images

The 2025 Miami Open presented by Itau will be held from 19-30 March at the Hard Rock Stadium. By ATP Staff

Novak Djokovic will aim for another piece of history Sunday at the Miami Open presented by Itau, where the Serbian is seeking his 100th tour-level title and a record-breaking seventh Miami trophy. The Serbian faces Jakub Mensik in the championship match at 3 p.m. local time.

UPDATE: The Miami singles final has been delayed by rain. Check this article for updates.

At age 37 and 10 months, Djokovic is the oldest finalist in ATP Masters 1000 series history (since 1990). He seeks to surpass Andre Agassi (6) for most Miami titles. 

View the full Sunday order of play below.

ORDER OF PLAY - SUNDAY, 30 MARCH 2025

Stadium - start 12:30 p.m.
WTA Doubles Final

Not Before 3 p.m.
ATP - Singles Final - Jakub Mensik (CZE) vs [4] Novak Djokovic (SRB)
